So if you enjoy table-top Games, Role-playing games, card games, are a bit off-beat, and have found yourself looking for a group that has a different feel than your typical gaming environment I encourage you to try out a different group like ours. results.description:
A Warm Welcome to All Lovely Ladies!

 

I'm looking to cultivate a small, special community of Manhattan-based ladies (in their mid 30s/mid 40s) to join me in making new friends, learning new things, exploring new places, discussing new ideas, tasting new foods, finding new gems ...and keeping the old ones!  More specifically, I'm looking to find the most wonderful, like-minded, fun, bright, cultured, interesting, creative, professional, sophisticated, diverse, articulate career women to get to know/grow with/learn from/have a great time around, long-term.  So- please be courteous, reliable, warmhearted, punctual, open-minded, trustworthy, intelligent, well-spoken, and communicative.  Thanks!

 

Our current ladies are all truly amazing, fun, brilliant women from all over the globe, who work in many various fields: (off the top of my head!) technology, medicine, science, education/academia, performing and visual arts, nonprofits, human resources, fashion, artisan craftsmanship, fine arts, interior design, caretaking, accounting, business, management, finance, law, business development, digital media, marketing, sales, merchandising, real estate, television/film production, and journalism- among tons of other fascinating things!


For now, I've scheduled a handful of smallish events so that we can get to know each other, and also due to venue sizes.  I'll add in some larger ones later!  Please feel free to suggest ideas and start online discussions/polls.  If you're interested in an event and can't make it, pls post that so that we can prioritize you next time, and/or make it recurring.  If there's a filled wait list, I may expand our reservation if the situation allows.  I'm not one to send "reminders", so please be do be aware of our seatings when choosing to RSVP, and pls also check & confirm final details beforehand, as I'll remove unexplained no-shows.


Please note:  We'd like to get a feel of who you are (hopefully all/most of the above!), so pls do answer as completely as you are able.  I'd also like to keep this group relatively small to get to know one another, so please chime in occasionally if you're still interested and just happen to be unavailable.  If you become removed, please feel free to re-request when you are more free to join us!


Please post a headshot with your profile, or send one along with your request, so we can find you.  Incomplete requests, non-answers, and/or those without recognizable faces will remain pending.

 

If you see an upcoming event you would like to attend before we see your request (or have space, thx for your patience!), please feel free to email me directly, and I will be happy to invite you if there is a space available.


Thanks again- we look forward to meeting you soon!
results.name: ! Lovely Ladies Lunching !

This exclusive upscale social group is for polished and refined professional black women

(ages 30 - 45 yrs)

Our events cost $100 - $300 per person and require upfront deposits or advance purchase.

**Please read below before requesting membership.**

The women in this group are:

  • well-educated
  • polished
  • refined
  • drama-free
  • financially stable
  • accomplished
  • drama-free
  • confident
  • positive; and
  • drama-free

We enjoy attending upscale gatherings and regularly treat ourselves to:

  • luxury afternoon teas
  • wine tastings
  • luxury weekend getaways
  • luxury spa days

NOTES

  • A HEADSHOT PHOTO IS REQUIRED - A photo clearly showing your face is required to join - no exceptions.  After your membership is accepted, you may remove the photo or change your privacy settings so that the photo is only viewable by group members (the group's privacy settings are set so that member information is not viewable by the public).
  • NO SOLICITATIONS - This is not a business networking group.  We gather to escape from work related matters.
  • NO-SHOWS - One (1) 'No Show' results in removal from the group.
  • Active participation is required.  Members must attend one (1) event within three (3) months of joining and continue to participate  to remain a member.

results.description:
Do you ever think about the culture we create and live in and how to create mental health? For example, what is "normal" and who decides?  Whether labels like "sanity" and "normalcy" "depression" "anxiety" are helpful or traumatizing?  Is there a relationship between what's happening in the world and our emotional life? How can we develop the world and ourselves creatively, culturally, artistically?  Can we create a new psychology?

This meetup group will feature events in NYC that will engage these and other questions. Please join us and let's explore the topic together -- I find it a source of endless fascination.

results.description:
Bismillahir Rahmanir Raheem

Salaamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh to all those near and far who may come across this group.

First, all praise belongs to Allah Most High for without the Creator, we the creation are void of a purpose in life. I also send peace and blessings upon the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).

This group is designed for both in person and virtual meetups in which there will be first and foremost the remembrance of Allah Most High followed by sisterhood activities which will promote love and fellowship among all of us as sisters. Even if we are only to meet in person once or even if sisters only make our virtual meetups, may Allah Most High allow us to meet at an even better gathering in Jannat al Firdous, in shaa Allah.

This group is also open to women who are interested in Islam and knowing what it is and what we truly believe. The media portrayal of Islam and even sadly some of our masajid today are not the best portrayals of what Islam is and the pure and beautiful message to worship One God that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought to us and lived out in his beautiful example as the best of mankind.

We will also strive to make all events family friendly and try to accommodate sisters who need to bring children to events. Indeed our kids are our future so to have them around us is a blessing and perhaps by being in the company of those remember Allah Most High, Allah Most Merciful will extend His blessings and mercy to them also and allow them to be one of those who worship Allah the Exalted from their youth and are shaded on the Day of Judgment.

This group is only open to sisters and the reason for this being that this group will strive its best to abide by the beautiful etiquette of Islam, including that gatherings arranged among sisters alone have the propensity to be more pleasing to Allah Most High and of more benefit for seeking out His remembrance.

This group is open to sisters from all over the World as we will have both in person and virtual meetups and our in person meetups, I will strive my best to be able to broadcast live to our sisters abroad so they may feel a part of our meetings as well. Alhamdulillah, Allah Most High has given us so much capability with technology. I ask Allah Most High to accept this service from all of us of dedicating ourselves to His remembrance and I pray that this group is a source of benefit to you in this life and in the next.

May we all love all our sisters in Islam for the sake of Allah Most High.

Was salaamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh

results.description:
Spatiotemporal analysis finds correlations between spatial events to make decisions. Our focus will be on learning techniques to prioritize 911 calls and 311 requests to improve health and safety in our communities.

Practice these skills by participating:

    Test causal relationships between time series

    Forecast values of a time series with vector autoregression

    Find buildings in satellite images with convolutional neural nets

    Fit autoencoders to initialize a deep architecture with pylearn2

    Train generative stochastic networks on GPUs

    Compare optimization techniques in scipy.optimize

    Search nearest neighbors with pykdtree

    Minimize network connection length with networkx

    Cluster topics with latent dirichlet via gensim

    Select models through cross-validation
results.name: Spatiotemporal analysis for community health and safety

results.description:
The MileMesh Meetup is about bringing together people who are interested in building a mesh network in Hoboken.

In the week after Hurricane Sandy we all experienced hardship and leaned on each other for help. FEMA, PSE&G and other institutions eventually reached the city to restore basic services. But our telecommunications companies were overwhelmed and unable to respond effectively in the face of unprecedented infrastructure failures. As a result, Hoboken residents and businesses had a very difficult time communicating with each other, with our local government, and with friends and family outside our community. We can't let Hoboken go off the grid like this again. And we can't wait for Verizon or Cablevision to harden their systems. Despite repeated calls from Congress and the Federal Communications Commission, the telecommunications industry is resisting new requirements for backup power for cell sites and other critical communications facilities. We have to fix this problem ourselves so that our community is prepared for the next big crisis.

A new technology called mesh wireless networking offers a fast, relatively inexpensive way to quickly build an open, free, redundant local network in Hoboken. It has been tested in Brooklyn where it proved highly resilient and provided lifeline Internet service to hundreds of people despite extensive flooding similar to what we saw here. We think it can work here too.

We are an adhoc volunteer group of entrepreneurs, technologists and community activists who want to launch a barn-raising style effort to build a mesh network here in Hoboken.
results.name: MileMesh: Hoboken's Safety Net

results.description:
Welcome to Chelsea Moms
Everything happening in Chelsea of NYC

Meetups are often set up based on age groups. If you do not see a meetup for your age group go ahead and either suggest one or set one up yourself. This meetup group is set up so that everyone can create meetups. I think this creates diversity and a broader range of activities.

From time to time we also offer workshops from professionals. These workshops are usually fee based and paid direclty to the professional giving the workshop. Otherwise all meetups are always free unless otherwise noted.

Visit the forum area to list an item for sale or give away or to buy yourself. I've set up playdate areas and I hope members will begin to use these to meet other moms with babies the same age.

results.description:
Welcome to the most coolest meetup group in NYC.  Science fiction movie fans! Tv show (classics & new) fans, Walking dead fans! Anime fans! Comic book fans!  Comic book discussion night fans!  Arcade video games fans! Open bar & burger fans unite! This is the group you've been waiting for.  I found several places in NYC, but mostly in Williamsburg Brooklyn that has all of this to offer.

Where can you find an open bar in NYC for $20, with movie nights & tv show nights?  I found a few.  Unlimited rum & coke, Vodka & OJ, cranberry & vodka and shots (rum, tequila, whiskey, vodka).

SCIENCE FICTION MOVIE FANS

Come in after work, grab a burger, beer or open bar and watch on two 55" HDTVs:

Star Wars, Spider-man, X-men, Matrix, Elysium, Thor, Enders game, Fantastic four, Superman, Star Trek, Avengers, Star Trek, Abyss, Hulk, Wolverine, Stargate, Pacific rim, Aliens, Event horizon and many more.

TV SHOW FANS:

NYC and Williamsburg Brooklyn TV fans how would you like to watch some of your favorite classics and new TV episodes weekly on a high resolution 55 inch TV?

Lost, Walking dead, Breaking Bad, Fringe, Almost Human, Agents of shield, Original Star Trek TV shows, Voyager, V series (old & new), The Event, Battle-Star Galactica (old and recent), Quantum leap, StarGate, Planet of the apes (70s), Star Trek next generation, Misfits of science, Manimal, Knight rider, 1952 Superman classics (black and white), Greatest American hero, Three stooges (black and white), Law and order, Lois and Clark Adventures.

Cartoons & cartoon classics: Voltron, G.I. Joe, Thundercats, Dungeons and Dragons, Superman animated, Justice league, Family guy, Futurama, Simpsons, Robot Chicken, Mask, Mr. T, Star wars clone wars, Superman unbound, Transformers, Batman.

FREE POPCORN FOR RSVP members that show up to meetup (limited time thru spring 2014).

Catch "Lost" and "Breaking Bad" from the beginning. Sit with other TV show fans and talk about your experiences, share your favorite moments. Remember the 80s and watch your favorite cartoon shows like Volton, Thunder cats, Transformers & G.I. Joe. If you like TV shows and want to meetup with other TV shows fanatics, this is the group for you.

We will also have comic book reading nights.

COMIC BOOK FANS!  We will have weekly comic book discussion nights.  Discuss or debate your favorite comic book character with comic book specialist Devon. Sit and read dozens of comics.  Or bring your favorite comic book to a meetup.

SCIENCE FICTION MOVIE FANS!  Discuss your favorite science fiction movie with published science fiction author Dmarcus.

ANIME FANS! We will watch anime animation on different nights with hard core anime fan Devon.

Join us and request what you'd like to do.
results.name: Sci-Fi movie & TV show nights, open bar, Anime, comics, food

This is also a brand new group.  For the time being, the plan is to get together to have a drink and chat with like-minded people.  As we get more folks involved, we'll start branching out into day trips and historical lectures, but the casual drink for people who are intrigued by American history is the mainstay for the moment.

I thought this would be a great opportunity to check out all these spots while also bringing neighbors together. Just imagine - A fun night out, meeting interesting people right here in the neighborhood, with no late night local train or expensive cab ride involved!

results.description:
# STARTUP is an organization started by serial entrepreneurs and investors. As many of you have probably experienced, the value-add of most startup events is minimal. The quality of talks and panels is low, but it is even worse when it comes to networking opportunities made available by these events. A chosen few get all the attention while rest of the attendees do nothing more than exchange business cards. Our goal is to provide a level playing field to everyone because it is our belief that you learn more from people who are "in the same boat" rather than from superstars who have "been there, done that".

We want to bring together entrepreneurs, investors, mentors, providers and others from the startup ecosystem. Together, we will build a community that is completely focused on providing high-value to # STARTUP members. We may restrict access or organize invite-only events (based on member relevance to certain events) to ensure quality of our events and conferences.

We are dedicated to building the best startup network in the world. But, we will not grow our network at the expense of diluting value to our members. Our long-term mission is to build local chapters that organize events and conferences in every major city across the world. Along with smaller local events, we plan to organize 6 consolidated conferences every year across 4 continents. Become a member now so we get to know you early on in our journey.

Here is what some members had to say about our Meetup:
results.name: # Startup - Premium Events for Entrepreneurs & Investors

results.description:
This group is an extension of my mission as the founder of Parent from The Heart.  It has been created to encourage like-minded moms & dads to gather for parenting support/education, productive/reflective conversation, sharing insights/helpful tips, personal experiences & positive feedback in a non-judgmental & casual setting. We can meet for an "adult-only" discussion in the evening at a private home or public location. We can also gather at a "family-friendly" venue where child care is available in a safe & well-supervised setting during the day.

My overall goal is to create an open, honest forum to promote awareness & mindfulness relevant to raising children of all ages with unconditional love, compassion & respect. I hope to inspire both men & women to develop a realistic vision for their family & gain the clarity/support needed for implementing this vision.  It does take a village to raise a family.  Growing together & evolving as a couple is a lifelong journey!  Let's recognize the challenges & conflicts as well as the joys & rewards of parenthood together.

As I have re-focused my career, energy & attention on raising my own children, I am equally passionate & dedicated to assisting & inspiring others who aspire to become the BEST parents they can be!  Your whole family will benefit from your positive experience as a member of this group. All relationships will improve, not just parent-child.  As you self-reflect & get back in touch with your core values/beliefs, your perspective will shift, guaranteed!  The gift is...you'll pass on these positive attributes to future generations.

Looking forward to meeting YOU soon!
results.name: Present, Passionate & Proactive Parents... Long Island (NY)

results.description: As a part of the City’s groundbreaking Applied Sciences NYC initiative, which seeks to increase New York City’s capacity for applied sciences, NYU designed the Center for Urban Science and Progress, an affiliate NYU graduate school focused on Urban Science and Informatics. Urban Science and Informatics is being defined in part through the inaugural class, but much of this contribution to the emerging field will occur outside the classroom and within the Urban Informatics Club. The club is open to all professionals and students interested in the emerging field. The objective of the club is to foster collaboration among different backgrounds and business lines through a common interest in the role of data in urban and environmental phenomenons.The urban informatics club invites planners, policy makers, engineers,data scientists, computer scientists, physicists and more to explore the role of data in cities, network, and problem solve. The club meets monthly and aims to have several panels discussing a wide-range of topics from the impacts of urbanization to entrepreneurship. Meetings are dynamic and interactive to harbor new relationships. There is no cost of membership.

results.description:
Welcome to the Microsoft Mobile App Devs of New Jersey Meetup! (#MMADNJ)

Our MISSION:
To bring together developers who are building mobile apps and games on the Windows platform. Starting with Windows & Windows Phone 8.1 today, and moving to Windows 10 over the next few months, our goal is to help you get everything you need to design, build & publish apps and games, and turn them into successful ventures.

Each month Microsoft hosts presentations and workshops for App and Game developers in Northern New Jersey, led by our team of Technical Evangelists. We welcome all levels of coders - professionals and students - and we are committed to helping developers be successful with their smartphone and tablet apps.

What we cover:

    Anything that has to do with building a Windows Phone or Windows 8.x app: deep dives into app models, specific SDKs, libraries, tips & tricks, etc.

    Game development for the Windows Platform using Unity, GameMaker, Construct2, XNA/MonoGame, C++/DirectX, etc.

    Microsoft Cloud for app developers, Azure Mobile Services, back-end data stores, Dev Ops, etc.

    Publishing your apps & games in the store, App Monetization, Advertising & Marketing.

    Windows platform apps and the Internet of Things (IoT), and also Kinect & HoloLens.

All members who attend the monthly Meetup can win raffle prizes from our sponsors such as Xbox games, books on mobile development from O'Reilly and Microsoft Press. Members also get access to other sponsor discounts and exclusive offers for possible beta programs or insider programs. We typically meet on the third Tuesday evening of every month at the Microsoft office in Iselin, NJ, and serve dinner (usually pizza) to all attendees. We also host special sessions, roundtables, office hours and workshops to provide technical assistance with building your apps.

While this group primarily targets app and game development on the Windows Universal App Platform, we also cover cross-platform technologies - such as Xamarin or Cordova - that let developers target more than one mobile platform.

Make sure to join us and RSVP for our upcoming meetings and events.
results.name: Microsoft Mobile App Devs of New Jersey (#MMADNJ)

results.description:
iOSoho is New York City's largest iOS Engineer Meetup.  We're best known for our terrific technical talks, and our restrictive admission policy of admitting only iOS Engineers.

Every month, we have 2 speakers from top companies in Soho / New York City present a 20-minute technical talk on what they're working on, and take 10 minutes of Q&A each.

We've had super-interesting talks from: Facebook, Spotify, Gilt, Foursquare, DOTS, Tumblr, Aviary, Thrillist, Oyster, SailThru, CocaPods, Spring (Jello Labs), TheLadders, and more.

iOSoho (EYE-oh-SO-ho) is a group for engineers working on, or seriously interested in, the iOS Platform.  We only accept active engineers, and serious product and design professionals working in iOS. We do not accept business people, "entrepreneurs", marketing, recruiting, "seeking co-founders", or casually interested professionals from other fields.  We're very sorry, but in order to keep our MeetUp audience, and interactions, at a very technical level, there are no exceptions to these rules.

You should join if you’re actively involved in the development of mobile apps using iOS (visitors from Android and other OS are welcome, of course) and you want to learn, meet, and share with others in the space.

You should not join if you’re not a “fingers on the keyboard” engineer. While we love and appreciate our friends in recruiting and the business, this is a space and time for iOS practitioners only.
results.name: iOSoho - New York City's largest iOS Engineer Meetup

results.description:
(Photos above were shot at our Fireworks meetup events in 2014 using a varifocus technique)

This group is for people who want to expand into different areas of photography such as timelapse/hyperlapse, light painting, trick photography, HDR, Off camera flash, etc...  For this reason it is important that you already know the fundamentals of photography and know how to use your camera. This is not a beginners group. The idea of the group is to expand our skill levels in photography by experimenting in specific areas, to take photos and videos that are out of your comfort zone. I found that time and time again, people not knowing how to use the various features of their cameras is what holds back their progress. Spend some time learning how to manually control your camera, it is time well spent. Also do a little planning and prep work before coming to the meetup, it will help you take better pictures.

(Photos above were taken during our Light-painting meetup events in 2014)

Some forms of photography require two people or more people working the equipment behind the scenes to effectively pull off a shot such as in the lightpainting shots above. A camera that can be controlled using manual settings and a sturdy tripod are the most basic pieces of equipment you will need for this group. All the photos shown on this page were taken using long exposure and sturdy tripods. (Below - HDR of Eiffel Tower at twilight, using bracketed 2 - 8 second time exposures)

Although not required, sometimes, additional equipment is needed such as  flashlight(s), flash(s), wireless triggers, etc... for our light painting or off camera flash events (depending what you want to do).

Lastly, I really encourage you to learn the software that has changed the way we develop photos. Probably the #1 program that has helped photographers make amazing shots is Adobe Photoshop. If you haven't learned it yet, I suggest you spend some time with this amazing program. I also encourage you to learn Lightroom. There are also many free programs available that one can learn to help achieve the effect you are looking for.

So bring what equipment you have as well as a open mind let's make some cool photos.

If you have a great idea for an unusal photo, either make a comment on the group page or come to our group meeting and let us know, we may choose to make it a group project.

IMPORTANT: Click here to see Membership policies in order to join.
results.name: NYC Experimental Photography

results.description:
New York City was once a hub of innovation in the field of electroacoustic music, but those days are long gone. While instrumental music of all kinds is well represented in New York concerts, it is rare that electroacoustic music is heard, and often works are not presented in the kind of ambience that they need. In order to improve this situation, we have organized large festivals of electroacoustic music in 2009, 2010, and 2013 (http://www.nycemf.org). We now propose to expand these events and create an organization devoted exclusively to electroacoustic music in New York City: the New York City Electroacoustic Music Society.

We invite you to join and become a member of this group. The organization will consist of composers, performers, and supporters of electroacoustic music. Meetings will be held devoted to the following kinds of activities:

* concerts, including those at the annual festival
* salons, where members can present and discuss their music with the group
* lectures by prominent individuals in the field
* presentations by companies developing products of interest to the field
* presentations by artists from other fields, like video or dance
* user groups
* presentations and discussions about the use of music software
* organizational activities
* social gatherings

 

Organized by the Steering Committee for The New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival:

Nathan Bowen * George Brunner * Ryan Carter * Dan Colson * Daniel Fine * Travis Garrison * Doug Geers * Elizabeth Hoffman * Travis Houldcroft * Hubert Howe * Howie Kenty * Judy Klein * Levy Lorenzo * Eric Lyon * Dafna Naphtali * Tae Hong Park * Terry Pender * Izzi Ramkissoon * David Reeder * Paul Riker * Meg Schedel * Zachary Seldess * Madeleine Shapiro * Roy Vanegas * Red Wierenga * Mark Zaki
results.name: New York City Electroacoustic Music Society  (NYCEMS)

results.description:
NYC METRO PET LOVERS WILL ADVOCATE, FUNDRAISE, EDUCATE, SUPPORT & HAVE FUN!

PawPrints 4 Pets is a Non Profit Philanthropic Club/Group/Community (pet) organization whose members (pets and of course their owners), focuses on community service, pet charity fundraisers, shared volunteered interests, and other pet charity organization support.

We enjoy:

•-- HAVING FUN & MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR ANIMALS! We have super cool Club member social events (Yappy Hours, PawtyBQ's, Howliday Parties, Meet -Ups, and more) to fundraise and also to just plain ole 'celebrate our clubs hard work & efforts! In addition we also build Dog Walking teams for Pet Cancer, Homeless Shelters etc. Planning our own Howliday Balls, Charity Events)! Our efforts support Animals/Rescues/Shelters/Foundations. In the past we've had walk-a-thons, bowl-a- thons, Merchandise fundraisers, Yappy Hours and more!

•-- Getting the word out and being an ADVOCATE for the animals locally and on social networks (Facebook & Twitter).

•--Investing our time and funds that we raise in local/national pet charities, rescues, adoption clinics, low cost spay and neuter centers, cancer research. These are just some of the pet charities that we love to SUPPORT.

•-- EDUCATING Pet Parents and raising Awareness

Our events are in  NYC (Manhattan, Brooklyn, and surrounding areas)!

We also have events  in NYC Metro Areas to include Jersey City,Weehawken and Hoboken!

*IMPORTANT* *This is a friendly reminder! Please Remember if you say you will attend after the RSVP deadline please do so. When you do not show up you don't hurt yourself only the animal's that we advocate/volunteer/fundraise for! One less hand or voice to help! So please commit if you are still a "Yes" after the RSVP deadline!The animals depend on us! :o)

**NOTE**: To maintain your membership, you MUST attend at least 1 event every 6 months.We are a non-flakey Meetup so two "no shows" or six months of inactivity - unfortunately, it could lead to your removal from the group.Membership is at Organizer's discretion.  We prefer quality over quantity and the animals depend on us!<br> *We do ask that you have a profile picture of you and or at least your pet!*

Join us on Facebook www.facebook.com/pawprints4pets

Follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/PawP4Pets

results.description:
The Internet is undergoing a revolution.

She is quietly shedding her skin and cards are emerging as the new design interface. But they are more than a new design trend. Cards are content containers that can deliver big stories in small pieces. They are individual information components that can be presented alone or in a series to create a user experience that fits our evolving consumption habits.

Join us as we discuss cards, what they are and the impact they’re having on content, design and the Internet.

Let’s talk CARDS!

results.description: Rescue dogs are amazing animals. But despite their wonderful, loving nature many rescue dogs develop emotional and behavioral issues from being lost or abandoned, or because they were mistreated and abused by their former owners. Some even develop PTSD, a serious condition that CAN be treated and even reversed. JOIN THE RESCUE DOG OWNERS SUPPORT GROUP! Monday evenings, from 8-9 PM. 131 West 72nd Street (b/w Columbus & Broadway), on the 2nd Floor. We get together each week to talk about what's going on with you and your dog. If you don't feel like sharing you can just come and listen. The meetings are beneficial either way. Our members have seen amazing changes in their dogs within just a few weeks. PAY IT FORWARD - HELP OTHERS - HELP YOURSELF - HELP YOUR DOG. No fee for the first meeting. $10 per meeting after that. Meetings are for owners only. Sorry, no dogs. Moderated by veteran dog trainer Lee Charles Kelley, a nationally-recognized expert on Canine PTSD. For more information contact us at KelleyMethod@aol.com, call (212) 615-6659, visit http://www.LeeCharlesKelley.com or http://CaninePTSDblog.blogspot.com/
results.name: Rescue Dog Owners Support Group

results.description:
The world has changed. Engineers are no longer the loner geeks, working in dimly lit rooms, hacking away for solely personal glory on side projects the world will never understand.

They have become the champions of innovation and the founding forces behind world-changing companies like Apple, Google, Facebook and many others. Engineers are in massive, disproportionate and obscenely high demand.

Today software engineers have their pick of any opportunity they want - your company, the company that wants to hire them to retain their seemingly magical engineering prowess - has only one shot at getting their attention. And you better be damn certain you make it count.

In this group we explore the most innovative ways that top startups use to attract (and note that we say attract, and not chase, bombard or hunt) engineers. In an engineer-friendly way that makes it count.

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills.

In addition, this is a great way to network and socialize with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

Our meetings are structured to allow everyone participate, practice and improve their public speaking skills.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month, and our club is located East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City.

To learn more about Toastmaster International, please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

results.description:
Are you tired of the "same-old, same-old"? Looking to socialize with other Gay guys, but need a break from the Gay bar/club scene? Well GUY SOCIAL is your remedy to lackluster nights out!

Put simply, Guy Social is a group of fun-loving, discerning Gay guys seeking alternatives to the nightlife scene and hook-up apps to meet like-minded guys. We love to have fun just like the next guy....we just want it on our terms, in a fresh new scene!

Each month we curate fun, interactive weekly + monthly events that encourage members to meet new people face to face in real time, engage more inter-personally sans tech, and develop meaningful lasting friendships....all while being charitable + having fun!

These specially created events take place at some of the most chic hotels, lounges, restaurants, and event spaces in NYC. Sometimes we'll host a brunch event, called GUY BRUNCH. Every one of our FEATURED monthly events and Guy Brunches will donate proceeds to a local LGBT charity. It's about having fun + being SOCIALLY responsible!

An annual membership fee of $25 gets you the reduced member's  entry fee to ALL monthly events, as well as exclusive discounts from our carefully selected Restaurant, Retail, Hotel, Gym, and Spa partners.(*membership is NOT required to join our group page or attend our events...you just won't enjoy all the PERKS or get member's discounts to each featured event!).

You can find out more of what we're all about, upcoming events, and sign up for a full membership though our website: www.guysocial.com (full memberships also available via link on our Meetup home page).

Now log off your computer, turn off your phone....it's time to GET SOCIAL!
results.name: GUY SOCIAL NYC

results.description:
Angel Launch has chapters in Palo Alto, San Francisco, and LA,, which for three years has attracted hundreds of investors and startups to weekly events. Join our newest meetup for events smack in the heart of New York City. Join our list and you will not get only get invites to our awesome venture forums and programs which we produce, but also free tickets to mixers, programs and summits from many of our partners.

Since we are based in California, we need partners to run events in NY so let us know if you are interested. We try when possible to get sponsors to we can offer free drinks and food, or have low cost options. when we have a sponsor, and all of our events are low cost with food and drinks. Many startups have met investors and partners at our events for long term deals.

We connect investors and angels to startups, entrepreneurs and small business owners for early and mid stage funding. We produce our own events, and also promote free events from our partners. With the large number of startups competing for funds, its difficult to raise funds and increase brand awareness to get the attention of potential funders. Many investors are looking for deal flow for early-stage startups including tech, digital media, mobile apps, social media, web enabled, devices, hardware, consumer electronics, life science, retail, eCommerce, media and entertainment. Our events attract multi-million dollar investors seeking funding opportunities with promising startups . We also select startups to pitch investors for funds at all of our events and we make personal introductions. Social networking is a huge part of our appeal.

You will enjoy networking, drinks, dinner, program and demo tables. You will hear from successful entrepreneurs who share their lessons learned. Network with prospective corporate customers and clients in your market niche. View cool demos and hear exclusive insights from tech influencers. Make new friends and forge deals and partnerships to make valuable connections. Join us now!
results.name: NY AngelLaunch

results.description: The New York City Bitcoin Meetup brings together Bitcoin users in New York City. This meetup is suitable for everyone from Bitcoin newbies to experienced Bitcoiners. Meetups will always be free to attend, and will include both commercial and noncommercial elements. You can attend meetups simply to learn more about Bitcoin. Meetups will enable people to buy and sell Bitcoin in person and thus avoid being scammed online. You can sell goods and services at our meetups for Bitcoin. Meetups will also facilitate Bitcoin business connections for entrepreneurs, miners and developers. results.description:
Cake & Cookie Decorating Classes

If you have always wanted to learn how to decorate stunning cakes and cookies and other beautiful baked goods, Brooklyn Cake Decorators classes are the perfect way to help you to learn new skills and to have fun doing it.Come along to one of our classes and learn how to impress family and friends. Our classes range from beginner to more advanced and will help you take your decorating to the next level.

Working with Fondant 101
This class is all about getting used to handling fondant in a relaxed, fun and easy envoronemt. You will learn some basic skills needed to help you on your way to making professional looking cakes.

Piping 101
Learn how to handle a piping bag. Work with some of the nozzles and tips to help you to decorate cookies and add those finishing touches to your cakes.

Gum Paste (Flowerpaste) Roses
Spend a few hours learning how to make delicate gumpaste roses in a friendly relaxed and easy place.

Cupcake classes
In cupcake decorating classes, you will learn how to work with fondant, to imprint patterns and create fondant decorations. You will also learn how to pipe those beautiful buttercream swirls, get creative with sprinkles, luster dust and glitter. When the class is over, you will walk away with cupcakes to share or just enjoy for yourself; as well as the skills to make more at home.

Cookies 
We also offer cookie decorating classes where you will learn the art of icing run outs,or sugarpaste sugar cookies with stenciling and brush embroidery, This will impress your friends and family.

Cake Pops
Ever wondered what to do with the crumbs left over from baking? In these classes you will learn how to make delicious Cake Pops on a stick and cover them with some fun and sophisticated decorations.

Advanced Classes
Our more advanced classes are focused on decorating larger cakes and learning more advanced skills. You will learn some basic piping skills, how to make a fondant rose and other cake decorating skills to take away and create your own master pieces at home.
results.name: Brooklyn Cake Decorators

Because great software engineers aren't "Java guys" or "HTML5 ninjas," we're problem solvers. We take an idea and build it end to end: from just above the bare-metal, through the OS, db, server, network, and browser, and all the way up to the user. We collaborate, code, configure, and deploy. results.description:
The Digital Health Research Group is a group of researchers, health professionals, and health data scientists who want to explore and discuss their digital health assessment and intervention research with a group of like-minded people. We focus on outcomes and mechanisms research to enhance digital intervention design and development.

Our first meetup will be in early December. Stay tuned.

Digital Health Research encompasses a wide range of research approaches that all have a digital component. These approaches include digital logs and diaries, experience sampling, ecological momentary assessment, ambulatory assessment, sensor-based research, and real-time interventions. Health-relevant outcomes of interest range from specific experiences and behaviors (such as affect and physical activity) to physiological states, location data, and social interactions. Our focus is on integrating theoretical models, study design, and statistical analyses to improve assessment and interventions in digital health research.

We welcome anyone interested in health outcomes and mechanisms of change. We seek out presenters with data relating to digital assessment or interventions from studies and consumer databases. Our goal is to understand how to help people improve their health and well-being through big and small data.

The best way to think about the Digital Health Research Meet-Up is like a mini-conference every couple of months with individuals presenting their research. We will have between 2-3 presenters at each meet-up with 10-15 minutes of presentation time and 10 -15 of discussion. Individual meet-ups will eventually have specific themes.

Founders: Fred Muench, Gertraud Stadler, Heather Cole-Lewis, Alexis Kuerbis
results.name: Digital Health Research

results.description:
Hi!

I am a Norwegian LifeCoach and Meditation Teacher who found purpose within the beautiful and natural human expressions, such as sound and inner communication.

When I was little I would often play games outside in a small mountain town, surrounded by the smell of earth, the sound of leaves in the trees and the view of snow-covered mountains surrounding me. Creative memories such as these are a part of what we discover in class. An inner journey. Of where you've been, and where your heart longs to go next.

Join us! Give yourself the tools you need to take the next step to personal fulfillment.

Every month KK opens her home to new and old meet-up friends to explore a new topic within Chakra Meditation and Transformational Self Development. Relaxation, Breathing Deeply and visiting ourselves through meditation is key to this practice.

Sharing together in the group is a vital part of the group, as well as drawing simple sketches of your experiences in the meditation.

We also always have tea and chat a little if there is time.

More info about KK and her other offers here: www.voiceandselflove.com

KK is an educated ILIANA Lifecoach and Meditation Teacher from the ILIANA Academy in Oslo, Norway. This eduaction is an extensive two year teacher program equal to a university diploma degree, which includes a large portion of practical training and a substantial focus on the ILIANA Theories for SELF-development. KK also has a degree in Advanced Therapeutics Anusara Yoga, as well as a Masters Degree in Contemporary Performance, where the voice was her main instrument.

results.description:
History: The Poetry Table seeks to unite poets of all ages, nationalities, ethnicities and linguistic backgrounds around a table of food, wine and friendship. By opening her home to the public every Tuesday evening, New York poet and founder Rosalind Resnick is creating a 21st Century "poetry salon" that encourages new and established poets to break bread, write poetry and build lifelong bonds of fellowship.

Who we are: The Poetry Table is open to anyone who wishes to use poetry to express his/her thoughts, feelings and ideas, from college students to retirees, from painters to bankers. This is not a poetry class, workshop or "spoken word" event. Our mission is not to critique our members' poetry but to provide a warm and supportive environment in which they can create it. Ultimately, we hope to encourage poets around the world to start their own Poetry Tables so that, whether you're in Paris, Tokyo or Istanbul, there will always be a room full of fun, food and poetry to welcome you.

What we do: Each meeting lasts two hours and offers each poet a chance to read aloud a poem that he/she has written and to receive feedback from our members. The highlight of the meeting is a 30-minute session in which each poet writes a fresh, original poem on the spot. At the end of the meeting, members read their newly written poems aloud. They also have the option to publish their poems on our website at http://www.thepoetrytable.com.
results.name: The Poetry Table

results.description:
We are a Montclair- based community-wide coalition of local groups, organizations, and businesses focused on making healthy the easy choice. Bike&Walk(BWM)  and Eat. Play. Live...Better (EPLB) share the goal of improving and increasing active transportation in Montclair and surrounding areas. We advocate for safe, enjoyable and convenient walking and biking.   BWM and EPLB’s relationship's with all our partners will help further our common goals and help create vital, connected neighborhoods. 

The Bike & Walk with Us  Program is designed to support and encourage individuals to walk and/or bike together to improve health, enjoy our local parks or walk/bike to local business. Walking is the number one activity people report for getting the recommended amount of physical activity. Walking/biking with friends and colleagues helps you stay motivated and continue  a life-long health behavior. This is a group for anyone interested in walking, biking, being social and advocating for bike & pedestrian safety. 

Our strength as an advocacy organization grows with the size of our membership; the more people we represent, the more clout and credibility we have. 

Making your neighborhoods better for walking & biking is about more than better footpaths and crossings or lower speed limits. It is also about building friendly streets, getting people to walk & bike more and a whole of things you can do to help.  

Support from our members ensures our financial sustainability and allows us to:

·  Continue to innovate and make our streets a safe place for everyone.

·  Host more events for more people every year

·  Take on bigger issues and better serve our community.

Help make our voice heard. Become a member today email liz.brady13@gmail.com for more information. 

Join Bike&Walk Montclair and help make your streets better for walking and biking.

We look forward to a world in which people choose to travel in ways that benefit their health and environment

We use open data, user research and other metrics to visualize trends to support our city. We offer innovative ways to use the web and mobile software in government operations and community outreach for residents to be informed and empowered.

We are the official local Code for America Brigade. Code for America is a non-partisan, non-political 501 organization founded in 2009 to address the widening gap between the public and private sectors in their effective use of technology and design.

We need everyone to participate. Come join other developers, designers, data geeks, civic leaders, community organizers, and idea-makers and get involved in making a change.

There are so many wonderful opportunities to practice with communities in other boroughs of NYC--but not so many in Queens. Let's create mindful community right here in our own neighborhood so we can support one another and practice together. This Meetup group will be used to post local mindfulness events, meditation classes, dharma talks, and more. No experience with meditation or mindfulness necessary. All experience levels welcome. If you know of a mindfulness event happening in Astoria (or in other Queens neighborhoods,) please let the organizer know. Please note: you do NOT have to live in Astoria (or even in Queens) to attend one of our meetups.

Like our Facebook page for updates, news, articles, and more.

results.description:
Dear New Yorkers,
New York has become one of the most expensive city in the world and I thought it would be great to post as many free events as we can.
Of course, I am not that genius who knows everything about anything, so once the group reaches a decent amount of members, I hope I will find a good dozen of organizers willing to help.
How ? Just share with me the free event you heard about ! My email is siris@outlook.com

Friends, that being said, lets get started, life is short and there are hundreds of FREE FUN EVENTS with GREAT people every month in the city that never sleeps !
Who should join ?
- busy people, just get on the mailoing list and find the right thing to do at the good moment
- smart people, people who won't pay a $75 VIP BS ticket when then they can go somewhere else... for free
- people interested in fun, arts/museums/galeries, social events, nightclubs crazy nights, and afterwork low-key get-together
- new in town adventurers
- whoever is single and wants to be out of the singles events for a while, best chance to find your soulmate !
In addition, we think that Al Pacino, Bill Murray, Julianne Moore, David Bowie, Susan Sarandon, Nicole Kidman, Yara Maalainine, Jean-Philippe (The Vicomnte) and Piper Perabo should join as well.

Thank you and good luck !
Siris Amsterdam
results.name: ! Free New York City !

results.description:
Who We Are

The YONY/Rivertowns Creative Meetup is dedicated to accelerating an emerging creative and tech business corridor along the Hudson River in Westchester County that is transforming our former industrial waterfronts and downtowns into economic generators once again. Our mission is to inspire with the insight of creative leaders, to establish connections with people and resources to help our members flourish, and to promote the clustering of tech and other creative industries in Downtown Yonkers and communities along the Hudson.

This Meetup is presented by YONY Initiative, Inc., Sarah Lawrence College and The City of Yonkers.

Who Should Join?

Our goal is to build community and expand opportunity by hosting the Lower Hudson Valley’s ultimate networking event for those who are passionate about tech, biotech, green tech, new media, social marketing, digital design, e-publishing, start-ups, finance, economic development, urban planning, architecture, public policy, advocacy, writing, the commercial and fine arts, and the full array of knowledge industries that are being transformed by technological innovation.

Our Monthly Event

We will meet each month at the Yonkers Riverfront Library, a growing cultural and social hub in the region.  The Meetup will include a catered networking reception followed by a talk with a prominent creative leader, concluding with an audience Q&A session.  The networking will continue at an after-party at a nearby local restaurant.
results.name: YONY Rivertowns Creative Meetup

results.description:
This group is about a new and different kind of FUN! You believe in fun too, don't you?

What a great city this is, including its potential for much more. This meetup creates a space where we can join together to make it even more happy and healthy. Our main meeting place is easy to find between City Hall and the Mount Vernon East station.

When we connect to learn how to intentionally focus our conscious thoughts on how we would like this town to blossom into 2014, we create a powerful force for good. Many visualizing and working together can achieve more. We'll think and act in ways that are positive and leave no room for the negative in our minds or lives. 

We will: 
-learn powerful but simple techniques to knock out serious problems, e.g., depression, PTSD, addictions and phobias. 
-seek to contribute to a loving environment which is where the deepest healing happens. 
-practice communication tools that are based on respect and empathy (aka Non-Violent Communication).
-share our ideas, ways of coping, and questions about anything impacting the quality of life for the community, our families, or our selves.
-share all these things with anyone in the world who has been searching .

results.description:
This is a John of God in Brazil support group connecting people in New York area.  We provide Casa Meditation gathering for people who have seen John of God, and information events for people who have not seen him guiding how to receive his magical healing work . 

The main purpose of this group was established, for not to forget what we learned at the casa, the magical possibilities we witnessed there, and bring that loving energy back to our everyday lives.  Yet healing takes time and we go through different spiritual experiences that we can not understand and we are not able to talk to everyday people.  It's not easy going through all by yourself.

The founder/organizer Kumi simply wanted to create a space so we can talk about our experiences and support each other.  Wanted to make the experience of Abadiania not only a wonderful memory, but to bring the love and joy back here, because the reason we John of God is to be happy here at home. 

Kumi visited Abadiania the first time in April of 2013 more from a curiosity, then she met "Spirituality".  She flew back in August of 2013 again to find out more.  When she returned from Abadiania, she decided to take her spiritual path with John of God and the entities of Casa de Dom Inacio de Loyola.  Her commitment established the group, John of God Brazil - New York Community in November of 2013.  In April 2014 she returned to the Casa and informed the Casa administration about the group and received blessings from John of God.  

The meditation gathering is for people who have been to Abadiania or have seen John of God, also for those of you who received distance healing.  The group is now giving events for people who have not seen John of God and interested in learning and seeing him.  There are many ways and protocols to receive healing from John of God we are happy to provide what is waiting for you.     

The group is still small but the energy we've been creating is powerful and beautiful.  Come join us and let's continue the healing.  Share the love, joy and happiness of Abadiania!

Love & Light

Kumi

clarakumi7@gmail.com
results.name: John of God Brazil - New York Community

results.description:
I originally titled this meetup "How to Compute Anything," as a play on Douglas Hubbard's book "How to Measure Anything: Finding the Value of Intangibles in Business." I'm interested in meeting game changers (including analysts, scientists, engineers, mathematicians) who want to understand, instrument, and change the world.

I want to go beyond vanity metrics, to measure and impact real things I really care about. I think computers can make that easier, by crawling data, collecting human judgments, and closing the loop.

Everyone, from people who spend their workday in Excel, to hardcore computer scientists and statisticians, are welcome.

Presentations on personal projects or stuff you're learning are welcome and appreciated. Research, not-for-profit, and business presentations and sponsors are welcome if your organization explicitly and reflectively measures and influences "intangibles" in a closed loop (which can involve humans and human judgment, because reality is messy).

So, let's meet up and exchange ideas, argue for optimal leverage points, synthesize cares and concerns, and start building stuff. Finally, we all care, but we also all have lives: Let's orient towards systems, leverage, and timeboxing vs heroics.


• How to Measure Anything [Amazon]

• A Guide to Actionable Measurement [Gates Foundation; pdf]

• Effective Altruism [Wikipedia]

• Bill Gates: My Plan to Fix The World's Biggest Problems [WSJ]

• Why Software Is Eating The World [WSJ]

• Seeing Like A State [Amazon]
results.name: Computing Good

results.description:
Musa Muhaiyaddeen (E. L. Levin) has a rare gift for making the teachings of Sufism accessible to westerners and teaches in a very grounded way, distilling esoteric concepts into useable and understandable language. Musa is a direct disciple of the Sufi Saint Bawa Muhaiyaddeen. As Musa explains, Sufism goes beyond all languages, religions and cultural backgrounds. This is a path open to all seekers of the unseen, those striving to connect to their spiritual inner life, to give new meaning and direction that is easily put into practice.

You can hear many of Musa's discourses on his website at www.thewitnesswithin.com. His latest book, The Elixir of Truth: Journey on the Sufi Path, is available through Amazon.com.

To quote Musa, “There is this mystery of man’s relationship to God. Every person has this relationship. We need to explore this relationship, and make that exploration something that is a life-long priority. We identify with our bodies, but we are not our body. Similarly, we identify with our culture, language, religions, but we are not any of these things either. Our true story is the story of our real identity. We need to find what and who that is. Just as we have duties to our family, and within the work-sphere, at the same time we also have to do what is necessary to understand where reality is, and who we are in that reality. That, in fact, is our primary duty.”

A zikr recitation follows every talk and all are invited to join in.

These talks will be given at the New York Open Center, 22 East 30th Street, New York, New York 10016. 

All are welcome to attend, and there is no admission charge.

If you have any questions please call: 610.334.7096

(Required statement: We are not sponsored by The Open Center)

Our ballet group is for anyone intrested in movement,dance and improving coordination; balance, posture, musicality and rhythm. Beginners as well as returning adults, all levels are welcome. 

No previous dance experience is necessary for the elementary classes. If you have previous experience the intermediate classes are for you. 

Join our dance meetup for recreation and pleasure, as well as in-depth instruction. If you are looking to balance out the long hours at work with insufficient movement and have a great time; the sheer joy of moving, interpreting the steps, moved by the music, expressing yourself through your body in an artistic and creatively satisfying manner, these classes are for you. 

Many of my students who would not think of exercising at the gym, get many of the same benefits in this enjoyable social setting. They forget the worries and stresses of the day as they focus on coordinating their movements to the music. 

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance, and provides a complete full-body workout. 

Physical Benefits: 

• Sculpts and tones your body 

• Decreases excess body fat 

• Strengthens the back, the abdominal muscles and the rest of the bodies core muscles 

• Promotes flexibility and range of motion 

• A stronger and more graceful gait 

• Can reduce back pain caused by weak abdominal muscles 

Emotional Benefits: 

• Joy of movement Helps to relieve stress 

• Promotes creative expression 

• Develops balance poise, grace and body awareness 

• Increases self-confidence through improved posture appearance and health 

• Provides increased social interaction

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses

results.description:
Hello and welcome. This group is for anyone who has lost a loved one. It is an open group where you can meet others who understand your pain, loneliness and alienation. This is where you can stop pretending, where you can feel safe being honest about how you feel and know that you are with people who understand without you having to explain.

My intention for this group is to provide a guided approach to grieving - think of this as inexpensive group therapy. Each meeting will focus on an aspect of the grieving process, drawn from my own personal experience and from what has been expressed by many others in the grief support groups that I facilitate which are less structured and purposeful. 

We will explore these through discussion and reflection and sometimes, learn new tools such as meditation techniques, breathing exercises and other strategies to support your healing.

Our meetings will be limited to 8 members to allow for more in depth discussion and adequate time for each person to share.

I have learned that with the right guidance, support, association and personal work, we can travel though grief, learning about ourselves, our relationships with others and the greater whole and become more resilient and more whole than we ever hoped or expected from the tragedy that we have experienced. 

This is what I hope for you.


About Me:

I am a personal consultant, music therapist, grief counselor, entrepreneur and concert violinist. My husband "JP" passed away on December 17th, 2008 from terminal brain cancer. I was his primary carer for almost 3 years. We lived in Australia but after his passing, I came to the US to seek out answers, to rebuild myself and my life, and to understand the purpose for this life experience. 

Now, 5 years on, I am extremely grateful to find myself feeling more joy and peace in my 'beingness' than I ever thought possible. Out of the shadows and sorrow, I find a lightness and purpose that I suspect I may never have found had I not had to endure and transform the pain of my husband's passing. 

JP changed me for the better in life and even more so, in death.
results.name: From grief to transformation

results.description:
“The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.” Augustine of Hippo

She’s a nomad is a group dedicated to the free spirit of women who travel abroad by means of backpacking. Backpacking is a form of low-cost, independent international travel. It can include the use of a backpack or similar luggage that you can carry over long distances; the use of public transport; inexpensive lodging such as youth hostels, cheap hotels a longer duration of the trip than most conventional vacations, potentially for weeks or months; and a strong interest in meeting locals in areas you pass through, absorbing the culture while you see the sights. Backpackers tend to want to experience the world in greater detail, and engineer their trips to make this happen through a slower pace and more communal forms of travel, typically through public transport. So let's get together, swap travel stories, talk about our next trip and meet new friends to travel with. Carpe Diem!
results.name: She's a Nomad

results.description:
"Our History"

 Our meetup.com page was started by me Eddie. I came up with this team name from a comic book called Fear Lord's. I thought the team name was cool and I like their comic books storyline, so therefore I'd decided to name our team F.L = "Fearsome Lords".

 Our motto is simple, "Play hard and Die hard". 

We don't have rules per say instead we have guidelines for our community:

Guideline # (1).Loyalty - Bear true faith and allegiance to Christ or what ever you believe in, the O.S.U., your squad and other Soldiers.

Guideline # (2).Duty - Fulfill your obligations.

Giideline # (3).Respect - Treat people as they should be treated.

Guideline # (4).Selfless Service - Put the welfare of the O.S.U. team, and your subordinates before your own.

Guideline # (5).Honor - Live up to Christ-like values.Integrity - Do what’s right, legally, biblically and morally.

Guideline # (6).Personal Courage - Face fear, danger, or adversity [physical or moral].

Guideline # (7) Cheaters if caught will face the "IRONMEN" (a firing squad ) and if you continue to cheat your banned from the team

Rule # (8) DO NOT STEAL (if caught you will be banned from the team!).

"Fearsome Lords" Paintball Community goal's are to play everywhere and anywhere as a private party group.We do enjoy traveling to other paintball fields and organize bus trips if our numbers are strong showing and if not we stick to carpools if we can. Our team consists of many professionals with well diverse backgrounds. We're a great bunch of cool guy's and lady's ,so we would to like keep it that way.Our team goal is to enjoy 

1).Speedball 

2).Woodsball 

3 ). Magfeed 

This will allow all player's to have the opportunity to try each one.

If you do not know about paintball then just come along and we will teach you. You can Google paintball or go to Youtube in order to learn about the sport especially the tactics of woodsball or speedball. 

Check out my Facebook page

https://www.facebook.com/fearsomelords 

You want to try airsoft go to our second page Fearsome Lords Airsoft team on meetup.com (tip: type airsoft in search box and the change miles to 100 miles instead) or just go to this link below

http://www.meetup.com/Fearsomes-Lords-airsoft-team

Thank you for joining and we look forward to meeting you for some fun!
results.name: Welcome to our "Fearsome Lords" Paintball Community!.

results.description: Are you interested in learning the art of mosaic making and sharing best practices in creating mosaics? You have found your artful home at Northern NJ Mosaic Creations! I am seeking to gather a group of creative folks, looking to discover and share mosaic art together. We will meet in an indoor/outdoor space depending on the weather, to plan, discuss, and craft mosaic art. Most meet-ups will run 2-4 hours. I have been creating mosaics on various surfaces (wood, metal, etc.) with various tiles (glass, ceramic, etc) for over 5 years. results.description:
Welcome to Lightwalkers of NYC!  The main focus of this group is "Astral Projection" or "Out of body travel".   Neither name, I feel, accurately capture the full range of what happens during, what would be more accurately termed, multi-dimensional travel.

For one, you still (might) use a body - an energy body!  For two, we can go beyond the realms of the Astral.

The Primary Goal of this group is to provide a supportive space for those wishing to cultivate their spiritual nature by utilizing multi-dimensional travel. 

Another Goal (of mine) for this group is to experience group travel - the potential of traveling multidimensionally as a group.  This will require a certain level of preparedness, trustworthiness in all of the members, and dedication to the practice. But be at peace in the place you are at, because this will evolve naturally as a group.

                                                                             ---

We will focus on developing skills and knowledge to enhance our personal spiritual practice.  This includes energy & consciousness actions, activating and clearing the energy bodies, relaxation, meditation, directing the mind with focused intention, how to retain the information accessed in the finer vibration, and much more.  The real knowledge is gained through practice, and this is what we will Focus upon more than conceptual knowledge (although that has a very useful place too!)

The knowledge and understanding of the higher realms will become clearer as we share and grow together.  I am just as much of an explorer as you, and invite clearer understandings and sharings into the space!

The ability to focus the mind and become the Silent Witness is a state of consciousness that will greatly benefit multidimensional traveling, and will be developed by pursuing this practice.

                                                                             ---

 In reality, we will be developing many things while practicing multi-dimensional travel.  Life is continuous and inclusive.  This practice opens us to the understanding of Reality beyond physical limitation, and the Reality that Life continues infinitely.  And to the Reality of a Higher Self that knows more than the individual human mind. 

Your exercises and ventures into the higher realms will bring wisdom and clarity back into the physical consciousness. You will begin to integrate the lessons already being learned by you in the finer realms; more fully conscious of the  interaction between your physical self and the Higher Self of God - Your Soul Awareness of I AM.

results.description:
Humanism is a philosophy for the here and now. It maintains that humans have evolved on Earth, that there is no supernatural world to aspire to, and that we give meaning to our own lives. Humanists maintain that we have each other to take responsibility for the resolution of human-made problems, that with compassion, rational thought, justice, and courage we can create a world that benefits all humanity. We are passionately working toward a culture of peace, equality, health, and respect for Earth our home.

The Humanist philosophy respects and embraces the efforts of all caring persons, all faiths, all ethnicities, all traditions, and all nations to improve the perilous conditions of humankind. We value life, family, and the larger family of humanity. We believe in the ethical and peaceful pursuit of individual and community happiness and well being. We come together as a group to share ideas, learn new ways of thinking, and encourage others to do likewise.

Founded in 1974, the Humanist Society of Metropolitan New York (HSMNY), the Corliss Lamont Chapter of the American Humanist Association (AHA),  seeks to promote Humanism and free thought in our community. We affirm our ability to lead meaningful, ethical lives capable of contributing to the greater good of all people. We favor opinions formed on the basis of logic, reason, and empiricism, rather than authority, revelation, or dogma. Our goals are to:

• Provide a forum for mutual and public learning and improvement
• Form a warm, supportive community of like-minded people
• Counter the forces in our society that divide us and imperil our world

We welcome all who wish to participate. Join us.

For more information, visit our website at http://www.corliss-lamont.org/hsmny/
results.name: Humanist Society of Metropolitan New York

results.description:
Q:  Why should I join this group?

A:  Because you:

1) Have a passionate interest in politics;

2) Enjoy discussing public policy matters; and

3) Maintain a keen interest in foreign affairs / international relations.

The NYC Political Forum is a nonpartisan, all-inclusive discussion group that welcomes all New Yorkers to gather and exchange their passionate views on public policy matters, notwithstanding one's political ideologies.

Our regular monthly meetup usually include a discussion of the following:

• Local news in NYC and the greater metropolitan area.

• Domestic politics and public policies of national significance.

• International relations and foreign affairs.

For our side events, we conduct in-depth discussions of the following: political philosophies and theories; historical subject matters; the Constitution and court decisions; and other public policy matters.  To find out more about what we do, click here. 

While we welcome dissent and although we don't shy away from controversial, hot-button issues, we always strive for a respectful, civil discourse — therefore, we have a zero-tolerance policy for personal, ad hominem attacks, or demagoguery.

If all of the above fits your interests, you've definitely come to the right place!
results.name: "The NYC Political Forum"

results.description:
(New to voiceover, or looking to break into the VO business? Please skip down to the IMPORTANT NOTE below first!)

It's here: the first-ever Meetup group created by and devoted exclusively to working professional voice talent in New York City!

Unlike other VO groups focused on education, training, workouts, etc., our aim is to network working, credentialed voiceover professionals who live and work in the New York City metro by meeting face-to-face and discuss  daily work experiences, biz trends, and whatever else might aid our business, artistic, and personal growth. We'll experiment with a number of member-driven approaches to keep things fresh, informative, and useful for everyone.

While many of us have strong opinions on the issue, we strive to be non-partisan and open, and welcome working and experienced VO artisans from both the union and non-union sectors.

Admission will be limited, to assess the experience, proficiency levels, and skill sets of prospective members to help develop a framework that meets everyone's needs.


IMPORTANT NOTE:

This group was created by and for EXPERIENCED voice talent only. We're NOT another "get rich by breaking into the VO biz" outlet, educational school, or training resource.

This means all of us have committed to make VO our primary source of income, or it's a real, significant and very regular part of it.

In other words, we've paid our dues by doing this for a long time, and do it for a living every single day. Not part-time, not as a hobby, not as a source of quick "money on the side" with several months in between doing something else. It's our full-time job, or truly augments it (for example, some talented individuals do equal amounts of stage/film/TV as well as VO work ). If this sounds like you, we welcome seeing your application!

If you're "new to the biz", or "just looking to get into voiceover/voice acting", or simply want to "kick the tires" or "try things out" to learn more about the trade and see if it's right for you - unfortunately this group isn't designed for you. Please be advised if you apply, your request for membership will likely be rejected, and your/our time will have been wasted.

Please don't take this personally. Rejection is a daily reality in our business. Pros shrug it off and use it to drive themselves further ahead. There's a lot that goes into this profession, and it's not for everyone!

However, if you're still serious about doing this for a living in the future, there are plenty of outlets here on Meetup.com and elsewhere online that we highly encourage you to look into. Good luck in your search, and when you get more experience under your belt, we look forward to hearing from you in the future.
results.name: NYC Voiceover Meetup Group

results.description:
Jews For Fun stands for high quality entertainment, exceptional organization, upscale atmosphere, and exclusive events. 

Open for all Jews who are looking to have fun, good times, and meet others alike. Come join us for holiday celebrations, happy hours, NYC night life, outdoor activities, and more. 

You might wonder: "Why Jews?" and "Why For Fun?" "Every Jew is genetically predisposed towards great "success?" That's what you all think. We say: "NO. Every Jew is predisposed towards great joy, happiness, and fun!" In the long run of our history of persecution, destruction and anti-Semitism, we have forgotten how to party without pulling the safety break. Now the time has come to press on the pedal and shake it "like a polaroid picture." :)

 When we get together we want you to feel complete comfort, relaxation, joy, and to have an opportunity to meet new, interesting people. As Jews we share a lot in common and connect well with each other. Let's celebrate our rich cultural heritage and share what our ancestors gave to us: great sense of humor and infinite capacity to appreciate life. 

Jews For Fun, a 501(c)3 non-for-profit organization, was founded in 2009 in San Francisco. Having created over 20 most legendary and memorable events all over San Francsico Bay Area and LA, JFF has become the premier Jewish community and social network for young Jewish adults. 

We are excited to launch in NY and bring you high quality fun and entertainment JFF style. Please check out our Youtube channel at https://www.youtube.com/user/JemmEntertainment

results.description:
Embracing change is hard for each and every one of us. No one is immune. Not the skinny size zero on the bus or the fabulously fit trainer in the gym. But the key to living our best life is to always keep trying. If we are open, we can find inspiration and support everywhere around us. This group is here to help members help themselves (and each other) move forward with the changes they choose to make in their lives.

This is your chance to explore new fitness, nutrition and behavior options - basically an opportunity to "try before you buy"! We will workout, eat and talk our way through the changes we all want to make.  And when times are tough, we will be there for each other. If you are fearless enough to be authentically you and have the courage to share your story with those around you, then this is the group for you!

So, get off the couch, push away from the desk or crawl out of bed.  This is a new year and today is an opportunity to begin your journey to a new you!

I hope to meet each and every one of you soon!

Your organizer and personal cheerleader,

Chandra


A brief note about your organizer: I am on my own weight loss and wellness journey and I created the Inspired Wellness Meetup Group so that I could build a mutually supportive community focused on helping each other reach our personal goals. I've spent the last several years learning about fitness, nutrition and behavior change so that I could help myself and others move their journeys forward. Over the last several years, I've become a licensed Zumba instructor, an ACE certified Group Fitness Instructor and a Mayo Clinic trained Wellness Coach. As a member of the American Personal & Private Chef Association, I've chosen to focus on teaching people how to prepare healthy food that tastes great. I look forward to sharing my journey with all of you. I hope you are as excited for the next the next phase of your life as I am about mine.

results.description: Agile is over -- or should be -- "Cargo Cult / Magic Bullet" or otherwise. Here's some relevant reading-material on this: http://postagilist.wordpress.com/2013/06/15/hating-on-agi... Agile encourages -- at best unwittingly -- under-engineering. It encourages the "Do the simplest thing that works today; we'll fix it later" mentality. The result: "quality-problems", yet (this now as a suggested new motto) "Quality trumps Everything". That is, you don't really get any points from your client for having delivered "on-time" something so buggy that they decide to shelve it until some hoped-for future time when you can devote the time to it that's required to finally build it right. If you agree with me about this (and really only then, because arguing about this with Agilists is like arguing with "true believers" about the existence of some god or other), then let's get together over drinks once a month and strategize about how to make Agile a thing of the past.
results.name: New York Post-Agilists
