results.description:
Action Design NYC is a group of designers, developers, entrepreneurs, economists and others who are passionate about helping people create positive change in their lives.   

We sit at the intersection of technology (UI / UX, data science), psychology (behavioral economics, positive psychology), and advocacy, and we focus on exposing our members to cutting edge tools, research, and practitioners in each of these areas so they can apply the latest learning in action design in their respective fields.   

Whether the goal is to help people save more money, get in shape, cut down on electricity usage, or learn a new language, the idea is the same:  how can we use research in behavioral economics and psychology to help users build habits and change their daily behavior? 

Each month, we'll have a new behavioral researcher or practitioner share the work they're doing.
results.name: Action Design NYC

results.description:
Nueva York Latino Social Group

My name is Omar and I am the organizer of this group. I am a social worker with a background in group work. I value the importance of bringing people together and understand the strengths it has when similar minded people unite. This group is designed to be inclusive where member can be themselves and feel comfortable knowing that the organizer and group will create a safe and friendly environment.

The Nueva York Latino Social group gives Professional Latinos the opportunity to network and meet other people who have similar experiences. Nueva York Latino Social Group is a social networking organization for Latin professionals who live or work in NYC. We host networking and cultural events in NYC and also engage in community service with our communities. Our social group is for anyone who is a professional Latino that resides in any of the five boroughs in NYC. A professional Latino is considered anyone who has a college degree and is working in their respective field. Our social group gives Latinos the opportunity to network and meet other people who have similar experiences living and growing up in this great city.

We will have many social and cultural events such as the movies, restaurants, lounges, live events, comedy clubs, and much more. The Nueva York Latino Social Group will also partner with community members and other organizations and be part in community service and advocacy efforts.

I take suggestions and feedback well. If you have any ideas or suggestions for a meet up, please feel free to share them with me. Even though I am the founder of this group I value and respect people’s opinions.

Check us out on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/groups/298834220301089/

"Like" us on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/NYlatinosocialgroup

Follow us on Twitter

https://twitter.com/Nylatinosocial
results.name: Nueva York Latino Social Group

W.I.N.E.S. is a local group for Women Entrepreneurs residing/working in Northern NJ including but not limited to the residents of Essex, Morris & Somerset Counties. The group will meet once a month, weeknight at a local restaurant/bar for drinks, Apps, discussions & networking. W.I.N.E.S. is an informal forum for women to exchange business ideas, make friendships, nurture business connections & support each other professionally! We will plan to invite a new speaker each month to educate women entrepreneurs on various aspects of business growth. There will also be an opportunity for the Members to showcase their business & create brand awareness at the monthly meetings. The goal of W.I.N.E.S. as a platform is- (a) Creating Opportunities for the professional development of women through Networking, Mentoring & Sponsorship. results.description:
Who We Are

Education Idea Exchange NYC is a community of Educators, Entrepreneurs, Designers and Developers (as well as other Education Disruptors) who come together to foster innovation and disruption in the education space. This meetup is organized by 4.0 Schools, a nonprofit that brings together a similar community of people experimenting with new ideas in education -- from educators, entrepreneurs and creative technologists to parents and students.

Our Monthly Event 

In the first part of the night, 3-5 members working on an education venture or experiment share their progress, and get* feedback and help from the other meetup members. In the second half of the night, we open the floor for members to share what they can give* or what they need to get* (expertise, connections, feedback, etc).

get*:
• Feedback on your idea / prototype / MVP / venture
• People excited enough about your idea to join your team
• Connected to the 4.0 community (and the wider education disruption community in NYC)

give*:
• Your perspective on a problem and a potential solution 
 • Advice (pedagogy, problem validation, customer dev, feedback loops, product, etc)
 • Skills/time to ideas and people that really resonate with you
 • Access to your own network

If interested in sharing your venture or experiment, please fill out this form.
results.name: Education Idea Exchange NYC

results.description:
Welcome all nail fashionistas. 

This group is for nail bloggers and manicure enthusiasts nail artists, nail salon owners, nail techs, nail polish addicts. in the nyc area. We are starting this group to create a community around our passion, nail polish!

Share nail art, ideas, meet and greet, network within the industry

We will hold local shows at area venues to create opportunities to display your work and creativity! 

What better way to celebrate life than with beautiful nails, your best heels and of course a cocktail? It all started a few years ago in a nail salon. I loved the way my nails looked after they got done, but I hated waiting for the nail polish to dry. So I would buy the nail polish and try to polish them myself… Walah! Nail polish addict I became! How did the heels and cocktails come in? I wanted to make it a complete componet and lifestyle. Women love to have beautiful nails, gorgeous shoes and they love to go out. When they go out with their girlfriends they usually have cocktails! Hence The birth of Glam Nails, Heels and Cocktails.

Marsha B.
results.name: NYC Nail Polish Bloggers and Fashionistas Meet Up

Are you an entrepreneur and a Christian with a real interest in pursuing what it means to integrate your faith and your work? Do you wish you could meet other Christian entrepreneurs who carry a similar perspective - for encouragement, support and just to bounce ideas off of one another?

What We Do:

Our goal is to unite, encourage and inspire entrepreneurs who want to pursue their work from a Christian worldview. Whether you’re leading a venture right now, new in business, in concept-phase or simply love entrepreneurship, come explore with us how to integrate our faith and our work.

Our gatherings are designed to educate, equip and encourage entrepreneurs of the Christian faith in both the purpose of work and the practice of integrating faith in work in a way that truly matters.

The Heart Behind It:

Our heart is to keep this group organic with a healthy balance on both prayer and practical. We’re interested not only in what you do and how you do it, but in who you are as well.

Come join NYC Faith + Work to meet fellow Christian entrepreneurs who long to see God move in our day, through our industries, for the blessing and renewal of all things.

Welcome to Babes with Wings!  We are a sisterhood dedicated to the love of flying to many things aviation and the nurturance of high adventure in our airplanes.

We are friends first.  We are seeking new friends.  We want to support one another, enjoy each other’s company, and create events of mutual interest for a bunch of flying babes. 

We are opening up the Meetup because we have met so many wonderful women who just want to fly.   We want to help each other meet our highest aviation goals on our terms.  When a blue sky beckons, we want to have someone who is ready to preflight and go. 

We may want to meet for dinner and a flying movie or aviation lecture.  We are not an organization, a business or a club.  We don’t have a charter or mission other than to have Babe Fun.  Our decisions to fly or not fly are our own, and if you join us, you agree to make your own decisions as well.  We are not sponsoring events we are just inviting you to come along.

results.description:
Come join us for our weekly NYC Small Business Owners, Consultants & Salespeople meetup.  These meetings promise to be fun, full of energy & productive!

We differentiate ourselves from all other groups by not only introducing ourselves to the group but also by acting as a small business advisory group. Need help with a business problem or issue? We can help. We have been together for over 15 years and are always growing. Come join us.

We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month in Q2, 6-8pm @O'Lunney's
145 West 45th Street - East Side Entrance (ask for the meetup or Raphi or the people with drinks)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome salespeople, entrepreneurs, individual practitioners and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each other’s professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

Schedule for 2015

Breakfast @AXA: 8:15-10AM
Lunch @CitrinCooperman 12:30-2
Happy Hours @O'Lunney's 6-8PM

March 12 & Lunch, 19(Happy Hour),26 & Lunch
April 9 & Lunch, 16, 23 & Lunch/ Happy Hr
May 14 & Lunch, 21 & Happy Hr, 28 & Lunch
June 11 & Lunch, 18 & Happy Hr, 25 & Lunch
July 9 & Lunch, 16 & Happy Hr, 23 & Lunch

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:
- develop a sales plan
- develop a marketing plan
- with finances
- with HR issues
- secure speaking engagements
- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums
- meet other key people and partners
- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (212-222-3292) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8:15-9:30AM. Networking takes place from 8:15-8:30. The actual meeting and introductions are between 8:30 and 9:30. And then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once in a while we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors
1290 Avenue of the Americas, 16th Floor
(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.

Raphi Salem (212-222-3292)

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet

results.description:
Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually.  We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

Our community boasts of women from all walks of life.  From the mom-preneur to the business professional to the stay at home mom; our platform and unique community of “nice girls” creates genuine connections that support the creation and building of close relationships.

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”:  that is, one of your own design!  We believe you should ENVISION your story (and the ending it should have), EXPLORE life with friends, and EVOLVE in to the woman you dare and dream to be.  Find your passion in life. Feel fulfilled. Feel pretty. Feel powerful.  Make a new girlfriend (or five).  The Lady Savant Community is here to help you on your journey.

Our Lady Savants connect and collaborate through private events, an online forum,  and one on one interaction through Savanting Circles (mastermind group). Our members have access to a vast network of women from a multitude of various professions and life experiences. Establishing relationships within this network opens doors and stimulates conversation resulting in the creation of new ideas and close bonds. We are a community that believes in and supports the power of the female spirit.

Are you asking yourself is Lady Savant the right club for you?  If you answer YES to any of the questions below then you are in the right place:

** I want to be inspired to do something more, but I don’t know exactly what?

** I want to make true friendships.

** I need to network and meet other women business owners.

** I don’t work, but I want to learn and explore other options out there.

** I like to volunteer and help others.

** I want to take up a hobby or learn about new trades.

** I like to buy local and support women in following their passions.

** I want to find myself and passions:  spiritually, physically, and mentally.

If you answered YES to any of these questions, Lady Savant is right for you!  Come to our next event (you may attend one event before applying for membership), meet some of the amazing members, and join !  Don’t let another day slip away….this could be the door to your next Chapter in your life.
results.name: Lady Savant: An Elite Women's Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Welcome! We're a group of young women who get together monthly in a small group (10-15 ladies) to discuss a good book and enjoy some wine. We also occassionally have "no reading required" events in addition to regular book club meetings to include more members and try something new! If you're interested in meeting some new friends, please join us!

 

Fast Facts:

-Meetups are the second Wednesday of each month.

-It's not necessary that you finish the book by the meetup, but be prepared for some spoilers!

-Most of us eat dinner during the meetup, so feel free to come hungry.

-We're really a very fun and friendly group, so if you're on the fence, give us a shot!

Ground Rules:

-Members who don't attend a meetup after RSVP-ing yes and failing to change their RSVP to no will be removed after three such "no-shows."

-Inactive members (not in attendance at any meetups) will be removed after 6 months of inactivity.


2015 Book List:

January- The Snow Child by Eowyn Ivey

February- Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk by Ben Fountain

March- Thirteen Reasons Why by Jay Asher (Thanks for the recommendation Ashley and Kate!)

April- The Language of Flowers by Vanessa Diffenbaugh

May- The Art of Hearing Heartbeats by Jan-Philipp Sendker

June- Things We Set on Fire by Deborah Reed

July- Whistling in the Dark by Lesley Kagen

August- The Light Between Oceans- by M.L. Steadman

September- The Sound of Things Falling by Juan Gabrial Vasquez

October- Drowning Ruth by Christina Schwarz

November- The Round House by Louise Erdich

December- The Baker’s Daughter by Sarah McCoy
results.name: Young Women's Book and Wine Club

results.description:
The main goal of Ladies of Gotham is to create a safe space for women to get together and play board/card games. Our group is trans, cis, and genderfluid friendly; it is open and welcome to all women and all persons who fall outside of the gender binary.

Are you new to board gaming? Or maybe a seasoned pro? All levels of experience are welcome! Our meetups will be a chance for members to share their favorite games as well as learn some new ones. This group is a great opportunity to make some new friends over some of the best games out there. 

In order to ensure a safe space for you, our anti-harrassment policy is as follows:

Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming is dedicated to providing a harassment-free safe space for all of its members, regardless of gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of members in any form or from any source, be it from within the group or outside of it.

Members that feel like their experience/safety with the group has been compromised are encouraged to contact the organizer(s) directly. A member of this meetup is entitled to support and help from this group’s organizing team. As well as privacy and confidentiality with any and all issues reported to organizers as the reporting member(s) sees fit.

Members (or organizers) violating this code of conduct may be expelled from the group at the discretion of the group’s organizing team. 

(This anti-harassment policy is based on the example policy from the Geek Feminism wiki, created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers.

http://geekfeminism.wikia.com/wiki/Conference_anti-harassment)

Meetups run 1-2 times monthly with a variety of different games played at each meetup. Suggestions for games are always appreciated!

Donations to the meetup group go towards paying yearly Meetup subscription fees. Any excess amount goes towards purchasing games. 

Have a game you like that's already been played in the past? Let me know so I know to put it back into the rotation soon.
results.name: Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming

POLICY 

Need ID.

You can bring whatever you want except illegal things, which means you can bring light food, snack, soda, alcohol (Be responsible!), board game and whatever for fun. We only provide very basic stuffs.

results.description:
If you are interested in Wing Chun, this group is for you. No matter what your experience level, you are very welcome!

If you are a beginner, I will teach you. If you are an experienced practitioner, you get more time to practice. This group is open to everyone!

Our address is: 330 Neptune Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11235

We meet every Tuesday and Thursday at 7 PM - 9 PM.  

Saturday classes are from 12:30 PM -  2:30 PM, by invitation only.

The classes are $120 per month.

New Members get 1 week free, to make sure that they like Wing Chun and our school!

Please checkout our past Meetup pictures, or take a look and like our Facebook page!

Foundation of Wing Chun:

According to Grand Master Yip Man, Wing Chun was developed by Ng Mui, who was Abbess at the Henan Shaolin Monastery and managed to survive its destruction by Qing forces during the reign of the Kangxi Emperor (1662–1722). She fled to the White Crane Temple (somewhere in the Daliang mountains between Yunnan and Sichuan), where she met a girl of fifteen named Yim Wing-Chun whom a bandit was trying to force into marriage. Ng Mui taught Wing-Chun how to defend herself by distilling Shaolin martial art knowledge into a system that Wing-Chun could learn quickly and use without developing great strength.

To see what Wing Chun Kung Fu actually looks like, please do a YouTube search for IP Man or watch these videos:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7zYJPD6iqYo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o4AfVub1NWc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R5uL4dD4YJI

results.description:
This is a group for women interested in being healthy and fit for the summer months.

It is beginning this Sunday 03/02 and continues through Sunday 04/20. It will run for 7 wks. Each week, I will schedule a meetup on that Sunday to celebrate our achievements. It will either be at Bottagra in Hawthorne or Kafe Neo in Totowa. If you can’t make the event on Sunday, you can still participate.

If you RSVP “YES” for the event, then you are signing up to be Fit that week and that week only. It’s a confirmation you are making saying “Yes I will try to live healthier and loose weight.”

Once you RSVP yes, you will then be required to post in advance by day (Sun-Sat) in the comments section of the event:

1) Your meal plan (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, and a snack) 2) Your planned 30-40 minute exercise for that day. Studies show:

1) Small steps are best when trying to change your life so let’s do it week by week. 2) If you plan your meals in advance you are more likely to stick with the plan. 3) If you schedule time for exercise then you are more likely to stick with it. 4) If you have a group of people with the same goal doing the same thing then you are more likely to stay with it. 5) If you give yourself a moment to celebrate what you accomplished instead of wishing away your failures, you are more likely to be successful.

After posting, no one is to comment negatively on anyone else’s post. Or, you will be thrown out of the group.

I am RSVP’ing so look for my plan in the comments tonight. It will also work as example of what you are suppose to do once you say “YES.”

Love to All..Good Luck…And I hope you join.

Michele

results.description:
Piano Outreach of New York provides scholarships to children who cannot afford the cost of group lessons (much less the cost of private lessons). PONY allows its students to benefit from the same excellent, conservatory-trained musicians who teach the paying students of the Piano School of New York.

PONY's scholarships cover 50-80% of the cost of the lessons, with parents, schools or PTAs making up the difference. Class size is small: three to six students. Piano-playing skills, note reading and writing, ear training, and rhythm are taught, together with music history. Each class is designed to meet the children.s individual needs according to their ages, and all children are introduced to a wide range of music, from sacred choral works of the Renaissance to 20th century jazz. PONY classes are educational, inspiring, and just plain fun! Each student receives individual piano instruction at every session, performs for and with classmates, and plays duets with their teachers. Year-end recitals at Alfred Lerner Hall at Columbia University provide a tremendous incentive and are highly rewarding to all participating students.

PONY was incorporated in 2003 and has been approved by the IRS as a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization. It is an outgrowth of the Piano School of New York, which since its founding in 2001 has experienced extraordinary growth. Today more than 1500 children in over 60 public, parochial, and nursery schools throughout the City are enrolled in our group classes. At a time when spending on the arts in schools has been drastically cut back, the Piano School and the Piano Outreach actually bring the only music into many schools in New York City. In fact, The Piano School of New York has been placing pianos and/or keyboards in schools where no instrument is available.
results.name: Piano Outreach of New York

Activities that come to mind, or have been mentioned - ultimate frisbee, touch football, paintball, basketball, hiking, soccer, scavenger hunt, volleyball, kickball, paddleboarding - all tbd based on group interest, always open to suggestions.

You do not need to be from North Jersey, but I live in the Montclair area, so field/court activities will be in one of the parks within a reasonable distance (approx 20-30 min = from Bloomfield to Morristown etc).  There will be other activities (kayaking, paddleboarding) that may require further travel.

The first rule of Fit Club = talk about Fit Club - the more the merrier

Please note:  this is an activities based fitness group, all fitness levels are welcome, but please know your own personal limitations based on the activity for that day.  Joining this group is done so on a voluntary basis, and by doing so, you accept all responsibility for your actions, including any injuries that may occur. 

Update 6/1/15:  There is now a one-time $5 (or $6) fee to join NJFC.  Please read the NJFC document under the "More" tab, then "files."  And, please bear with me during the transition - this process kicked off approx 500+ members (mostly inactive) but it will take some time to rebuild in order to get big group activities planned again.

Thank you.

Holly

results.description:
We are a network dedicated to providing trained martial artists with opportunities to test and refine your skills through respectful, combative sparring.

This is a group for martial artists of sound mind and good character who would like to occasionally meet up and spar with others from various styles to test and refine their skills in an energetic, supportive, sportsmanlike environment. This group is for men and women 21 and older of all fighting styles with at least 1 year of formal martial arts training under a qualified instructor (preference for those who've actively trained within the last 5 years).

This is NOT a class, training course, fitness group, or seminar. We do not meet to "cross-train" or swap techniques. This is NOT a "fight club". Brawling and showing lack of reasonable control/restraint will not be tolerated. Maintaining the right group culture is essential. 

You must officially register before you can participate in sparring.  To get started, contact a group organizer on meetup or send an email to info@martialartsexchange.com.

Sessions will be respectful ("friendly") but also combative, meaning you should expect your partner to actively engage you. We use light or medium contact (holding back power, showing restraint when partner takes hard blow, certain kinds of strikes prohibited). Mandatory protective gear and rules are set and collectively enforced. You must be willing to sign a waiver accepting full liability for injury and sole responsibility for your own protection and safety.

Spread the Word!  Like Us on FACEBOOK

Click here to go to our DC/Maryland Meetup Group
results.name: Martial Arts Exchange - NYC

results.description:
This is a development-centric meetup group for mobile .NET development with a primary focus on Xamarin.  We welcome all skill levels as well as those with no experience at all.  Anyone interested in joining a vibrant community and deeply understanding the Xamarin platform is a great fit.  We will engage in actual development projects, with the entire team focusing on a particular problem, architecting and developing in tandem, and then comparing results with the team as a whole.  We will use best-in-class development tools such as: Xamarin Studio, GitHub, XCode, Visual Studio, SQLite, Amazon Cloud, Cassandra/HBase NoSQL, AngularJS, Node.js, etc.  The huge upside is that while we develop on the core technologies, we'll also be building up our skillset with highly effective and marketable ancillary technologies. 

The format of the group will be as follows: 

We'll meet as an entire group and define what we'd like to build in the upcoming sprint (we might as well use Agile terms).  The project definitions will be fairly narrow, especially in the early phases of the group while we're developing our nascent skills. So for example, we may say, "This week we'll build the map screen for a simple mapping application that supports push-pins, on iOS".  

We'll then break the group into teams of 2, attempting to balance out our experience and talent levels as well as possible.   After that point, we'll all go away and dive into the code.  Each group of two will work on the project for the duration of the sprint. We'll create an environment of open collaboration by way of an online project management tool.  

The following meetup will then serve as a code review where we will conduct the following exercises as a group: 

1) Compare architectural decisions and defend reasons for making those decisions

2) Discuss extensions and other third-party components used to aid development

3) Discuss your greatest pain points, or where you flat out hit a brick wall

4) Attempt to gain consensus on the best methods of accomplishing each of the tasks, and compile those methods into a best-practices reference

5) Merge our best code into a common area, and promote that version as group-certified (it's probably very ambitious to try to accomplish this during an actual Meetup)

Then we'll define the next project, and re-start the development cycle.  We can either completely start over with an altogether different project, or build new components onto the existing one, gradually working our way towards an enterprise-worthy app.  

One great thing about these short development sprints is that we can always bring on new developers at any one of our Meetups.
results.name: NJ Mobile .NET Developers

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

Twitter | Facebook

results.description:
In 1826 Josiah Holbrook organized the Millbury Branch Number 1 of the American Lyceum with the goal of bringing lifelong education through presentation and spirited debate to everyone. Mr. Holbrook’s great hope was to bring about a general and universal diffusion of knowledge regardless of age, gender or station. Taking the name “Lyceum” from Aristotle’s school, Mr. Holbrook’s efforts resulted in the organization of thousands of local Lyceums and the brief formation of a National Lyceum.

At Axial, we agree strongly with Mr. Holbrook that education is a lifelong exercise. We believe that curiosity and ingenuity are critically important and that you should engage in debate with friends, colleagues and experts on a variety of topics frequently and vigorously.

In the spirit of the 19th century Lyceum movement, we invite domain experts to our offices every month to give a presentation or participate in a panel discussion. Our doors are open to anyone interested in joining the debate (and of course, there’s always the free Sixpoint). 

The Axial Corps of Engineers is a team of technologists dedicated to pragmatically and predictably shipping innovative software. Some people would say we’re flip-floppers, but we reserve the right to change our minds when new evidence is presented. The best argument, implementation or design on any given day is the one we’ll favor at Axial, not the one coming from the person with the highest rank, title or most pull. We value practical consideration and self-restraint backed by solid communication over rockstars, samurais and ninjas.

We’ll use a framework, tool, language or approach as soon as it becomes obvious that it’s well supported, stable, low maintenance and the right tool for the job.

*We kindly ask that agency recruiters refrain from attending.

**If you feel like you have a relevant talk that you'd like to present, send some information over to alex.steinberg@axial.net.
results.name: Axial Lyceum

results.description: This is a group for misfits. Misfits of all kinds. It's called unusual because it refers to a special kind of misfit, where you are not necessarily a misfit in all aspects of your life, but one or more of them and you feel really unusual, awkward or inexplicable about why you were not able to fit in. For example, it could be at work, in your family, or in your dating life with same/opposite sex, or your surrounding society. These are the people who are waiting to fit into those areas that they always had trouble fitting in, but wanted to fit in. I understand that the name 'misfits' is used in television/movie titles, but I have never watched any of them. So, just to be clear, this group is not an imitation or is not inspired by any sort of fiction. We can discuss our issues as to why we are not able to fit in those certain areas of life - probably come up with a solution or just laugh it off and move on. Either way, you know that there's a group of people out there that feel something similar to what you feel.
results.name: Unusual Misfits

results.description:
Hi, 

This group is for everyone willing to practice French with a French native speaker. 

I am a French Interpreter with experience in teaching French as a Foreign Language. 

I taught French to adults and kids in different settings such as: universities, language schools, tutoring and Foreign Language Camps for kids. 

Every week I choose a different topic as a starting point for our conversation. I post the topic on each Meet Up page at least one day before the Meetup. 

Price is $10/person. 

All levels welcome. You should be able to speak and understand at least a little French though or you won't be able to participate in the conversation. This is a Conversation Meetup, not a French language class.

RSVP required. RSVPs close on Saturday 6 PM. Min. 2 persons, max. 5 persons per Meetup (+ me).

RSVPs are final: RSVP only if you can come. If something comes up and you can't make it please change your RSVP to "no" so I know who is coming.

For private lessons contact me personally. 

Looking forward to meeting you! 

Aurore

The Backpacking Committee of the NY-North Jersey Chapter of AMC has something for everyone who loves to backpack or dreams of sleeping in the outdoors but needs guidance on how to gear up and get out. This group sponsors backpacking adventures suitable for experienced Appalachian Trail through-hikers to beginners learning how to setup a tent yearning for a hot meal of dehydrated chicken gumbo.

What sets us apart?

• Trained leaders means trips are organized, fun, safe, and educational

• All backpacking trip leaders are trained in wilderness first aid

• Easy access via public transportation to many of our backpack adventures

• Backpacking trips are open to anyone (as long as you meet fitness, equipment and experience requirements) 

Anyone wishing to join a backpacking event must register for the trip and be pre-approved by the leader.  Some trips may have a small non-refundable registration fee of $5.00 for AMC members and $15.00 for non-AMC members.

This MeetUp group is sponsored by the NY-North Jersey Chapter of the Appalachian Mountain Club. AMC members take part in virtually every outdoor activity under the sun: from hiking to paddling and from softball to skiing. All while protecting the waters, mountains, and forests of Northeast outdoors. Check out all of our backpacking events on on chapter backpacking schedule.

Not a member? Join us today! Check out our official website.

results.description:
This Meetup will provide a safe space to begin the journey in understanding the justice system, both civil and criminal, and supporting one another in our effort to achieve equality in society using these systems.

The meetings will explore the issues related to intersectionality, including race, gender and class, access to justice, the impact of these issues on our personhood and humanity, and seek to develop a network of competent, qualified and committed legal professional to help when the need arises.

We will share our stories and learn what others have done or are doing when faced with various legal issues related to running a business, owning and managing property, obtaining access to justice to ensure equal pay, redress for violent acts committed against us or family members, and generally ensuring access to justice.

The mission is to build both a political action committee to monitor and comment on justice issues that impact our community and to form a non-profit organization to fund litigation, conduct research, and educate the community on critical social justice issues. We also seek to develop a prison to aid those who might not otherwise have support outside of the prison system.

In a Nutshell – this is a place to never feel awkward or alone. Note that while the focus of the group is on African American women, any woman who has an issue with the legal system or wishes to offer support is welcome to attend and participate.

The Mission: Arm ourselves for the "battle" ahead by providing an environment driven by caring and sharing, pooling our resources & knowledge and taking advantage of our strength in numbers to better assist one another.
results.name: Justice Speakers
